submission:
class Solution:
    def maximumValueSum(self, board: List[List[int]]) -> int:
        m, n = len(board), len(board[0])
        rows = [0] * m 
        cols = [0] * n
        arr = []
        for i in range(m):
            for j in range(n):
                arr.append((board[i][j], i, j))
        arr.sort()
        arr.reverse()
        # print(arr)
        t = len(arr)
        ans = -inf
        for i in range(max(m, n) + 1):
            x = arr[i][1]
            y = arr[i][2]
            rows[x] += 1
            cols[y] += 1
            cnt = 0
            for p in range(i + 1, t):
                nx = arr[p][1]
                ny = arr[p][2]
                if rows[nx] == 0 and cols[ny] == 0:
                    cnt += 1
                    rows[nx] += 1
                    cols[ny] += 1
                    for j in range(p + 1, t):
                        mx = arr[j][1]
                        my = arr[j][2]
                        if rows[mx] == 0 and cols[my] == 0:
                            ans = max(ans, arr[i][0] + arr[p][0] +arr[j][0])
                            break
                    rows[nx] -= 1
                    cols[ny] -= 1
                    if cnt > max(m,n) + 1:
                        break
            rows[x] -= 1
            cols[y] -= 1
        return ans
